D16F0B868E1848F7BF52596A2B3B9EE6.description:
Analyze how response to art is influenced by understanding the time and place in which it was
created, the artist’s available resources, and cultural norms.

9F8888687F8C40EBB9E0923C8ED56C1B.description: Collaboratively craft an innovative traditional/nontraditional theatrical work.

9B620BCCD62E4EE5B889EBDF884B3310.description:

a theatrical work.

DB5E4B25F07549669D7C8E31C2230375.description: Use discipline-specific literacy to clearly communicate personal aesthetics.

911C315001EE4F28B4110E8D4D636B43.description: Research and evaluate various productions based on the same story and/or theme.

2664F2B5D9C94643A67F74CF3B3DC69B.description:

disciplines.

88BECB260D96402FA51A49257CFF8E4C.description: Use historical source material to craft a theatrical work.

E152FFA24DF74C44BC9EFBDE319D85B0.description:

staging and interpretation.

Anchor Standard 11: Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical context to
deepen understanding.

A0E4607508A64538955804C29781F6EF.description: Lead others and interact with the audience in a formal or informal response activity.

EF43BA524CD74737A8FA064973192D3F.description:
While working with a diverse group, be flexible and adapt artistic choices to clearly
communicate theme in a theatrical work.

11A6E1F0DE6142C6B21F2F958B50FF54.description: Research a community issue and collaborate with others to devise a theatrical work.

BDF6E38654B0417FAB1C338DEAE9786A.description: Investigate a community issue through multiple perspectives in a theatrical work.

1577105F126C480F881FD0975BB0391E.description: Evaluate an effect a theatrical event has on an audience.

35D11B125C3C4C41BA289363C8F04A39.description: Analyze a production’s theme and communicate clearly how artistic choices help reveal it.

0C39DC92DDCB4FDA97B67F1566F46BCC.description: Apply standard analysis criteria to a theatrical production.

E6480CBBBBAB44EC900A0544310471E5.description: Identify how the intended purpose of a theatrical work appeals to a specific audience.

D9E6D61FDABD4AC1ACE1AD3B56EAD55A.description: Describe how aesthetic choices in production elements help reveal theme in a theatrical work.

BD5E8001D70D4DAF8BCCB32A68805FCF.description: Respond to theatrical work using specific evidence and artistic criteria.

6BC5ACB037EB497F94E535BC65408548.description: Anchor Standard 9: Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

D2BAAD5FBD0C4BE9865DE120DF4B9E36.description: Engage appropriately as an audience participant in formal/informal settings.

376FE0CA4515431D9B47035E3E9FEBF3.description:
While working in a diverse group, effectively communicate and integrate various personal
aesthetics to enhance a theatrical work.

A609AB25BBF74B5091FF05658973FEDC.description:
Research information on various artists’ lives and personal aesthetics and communicate
effectively how they informed their artistic choices.

9B678F595502473181F650C6E591D7A5.description:
Communicate clearly with others how personal artistic choices are informed by personal
aesthetics.

A2647E0F1C80454FAC6CB3F10C1FBADE.description: Identify personal aesthetics through participation in a theatrical work.

0340139BE6234DD3A7D52A490C8BFD31.description:
Explore various styles of storytelling in theatrical works and identify artistic choices in playwriting
and production.

6D18D57904254291B727F83BDF20737F.description: Explore how the use of personal aesthetics and artistic point of view inform artistic choices.

10D721619B8C4A4EBF56D952483EAAF2.description: Anchor Standard 8: Interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.

5CE4EEA6FAD346E7911D3A1710B89667.description: Use given criteria to evaluate the effectiveness of artistic choices in various theatrical works.

507C8C9D9E414620B551CFF82F166C66.description: Effectively justify and articulate the artistic choices in various theatrical works.

EA83868CA9944BD390FFBD530BA7263A.description:
Identify and analyze the effect of artistic choices by applying given criteria to a theatrical
experience.

5B4E4C8DB5FF47B48546C57146CC0924.description: Anchor Standard 7: Perceive and analyze artistic work.

6719FF239ABA42B6BAF2FF274BA951E8.description: Present a self-reflection on a theatrical work and one’s own contribution to the performance.

E8C3CCA32B4849CF8A5741F7517BD192.description: Interact with the audience in a formal reflection activity.

C81E696CEA704E67AAE3404B1B2C8BC2.description: Produce a play for an audience.

E2F4D69734C7440AA7256382B454C3B2.description:
Present a rehearsed, theme-based, and scripted theatrical work for an audience and engage in
shared reflections.

604D17477E8442D9B35524A4BF953818.description: Anchor Standard 6: Convey meaning through the presentation of artistic work.

6EDAA7BA35AB4F9A9B5BD64A86912395.description: Lead, develop and effectively participate in warm-ups and proper rehearsal protocols.

38DC82C44ED34F28986D1D4763BE0B5F.description:
Apply technology and implement innovative solutions to enhance a scripted theatrical
production.

BAABF466D46145B1BDDD9C1DC5F2DA08.description:
Solve problems by utilizing and applying theatrical resources for a formal scripted theatrical
work.

7CF08548C2414C8BB72376DD2A78EA9B.description:
In rehearsal, use acting exercises to creatively enhance a performance for a formal or informal
scripted theatrical work.

F4996944EE2442DFA38D40709DFD80AA.description:
Explore a variety of technical techniques to create a design for a formal or informal, scripted
theatrical production.

FE2C38FDFBA2406C9FBBB0FAD9FB2DA7.description:
Participate in a variety of acting exercises, and transfer techniques to a rehearsal and
performance of a scripted theatrical work.

A859440631484CB8BD864A9F7A5A761C.description: Anchor Standard 5: Develop and refine artistic work for presentation.

B1A6573E37744B9696510722B847E1C6.description:
Effectively justify and implement specific acting, vocal, and movement choices to create a
convincing character.

90CC91DABB94445E935D82C60B246DA2.description:
Work creatively with others to decide on and implement original creative artistic choices for a
scripted theatrical production

8299CD8CB66B43DDAD4FA27C4F991689.description: Apply provided criteria to make decisions on a script’s selection for performance.

5D42EA60D2BE4753A7FD813E344E8344.description:
Apply various acting techniques to expand the connection between the actor and a character’s
objective, motivations, and stakes.

2A37FB704CF745F78DA8FB0EC12C6EFE.description:
Develop and apply various artistic choices to enhance dramatic moments and thematic elements
in a theatre work.

057C11C7086D4657829E483231F51217.description: Anchor Standard 4: Analyze, interpret, and select artistic work for presentation.

302FAAA08C4D4291873118780A01A603.description: Produce a devised/adapted theatrical production for an audience.

E630D429EC2749FA97E14D1B3DD5570D.description: Use available technology to refine technical designs.

188992F5BAC44068807A0DB5A3A854A7.description: Make decisions on technical artistic choices and implement innovated ideas to refine them.

D1BA0CB71DC0471EA8919174B23AFEF6.description: Manage time and rehearse effectively and efficiently.

D71D67E9251B459EA45093AD417B72EE.description: Apply performance criteria to evaluate artistic choices in a theatrical production.

686610029D7C42F5B1CC94DEB2D3A99D.description:
Implement and refine a planned technical design using available technology during the rehearsal
process for devised/adapted theatrical work for performance.

766E168C2F8A4D9EA4BC164214A5B6AD.description:
Explore various staging ideas throughout the rehearsal process of a devised /adapted theatrical
work for performance.

4DC9FA2FDD8B4D7A9F791056E7B897A1.description:
Throughout the rehearsal process, analyze and refine artistic choices to better clarify story and
theme.

B96FC3A923B64C9F8A196E291F808073.description: Anchor Standard 3: Refine and complete artistic work.

7DAC0CBCD9CE4363AB974DA82FF154ED.description: Use available technology to enhance artistic choices in a devised/adapted theatrical production.

75BC4BB44EF244CE9A71C65368B6DEA9.description:
Be responsible to others and work effectively in a diverse team to enhance a devised/adapted
theatrical production.

ECA1984AEA4344D194293913CDBB6A65.description:
Manage a design project by sharing leadership and working effectively with others to think
critically about design choices and solutions.

4E3FB20DA9E44FC2BB879FD9ABE8491D.description:
Research information about the world of the play and work creatively with others to enhance
artistic choices during the rehearsal process of a devised/adapted theatrical production.

33A4542ACEEF4BBB94D3CF2E78E388F6.description:
Research and employ playwriting techniques and evaluate artistic choices in a devised/adapted
theatrical production.

CDB0AFD031074465B1C98ABA1BC0E72D.description:
Share leadership and execute responsibilities of a design team, and collaborate to incorporate
various ideas in a theatrical work.

E636A9C89549496EBE1D4601947BD42D.description:
Explore, and justify original artistic choices in a theatrical work based on critical analyses, and
background knowledge, based in an historical and cultural context.

A85A3D8E9AE249AF86D6A04ED14F6CA4.description: Think creatively and be flexible in rehearsing and producing an original theatrical work.

2EC0C53B60C84C6BAAD4080B2A80E486.description: Work independently to develop a character for an original theatrical work.

F7EB8867A47F4BE4A5C4D0C3B62601C3.description:
Collaborate with others to explore and analyze how design choices reveal story, character and
theme.

6A4E1832DBD642608DD90DE080B2970C.description:
Effectively reason and collaboratively make decisions on artistic choices during the rehearsal of

92C16EAFD0584EE68E5C6900AEB6F3DA.description:
Develop an improvised character using given circumstances, inner thoughts, objectives and
interactions with another character.

56EC941292ED41FC8745B69879D4B11B.description:
Explore how different design and artistic choices enhance story, character, and theme in an

2B65EF7840314C0DA6B78828F16A9BF7.description:

B17391C78E754B0FA7017982C82204A4.description: Anchor Standard 1: Generate and conceptualize artistic ideas and work.
